results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.creator_credit: Selznick Pictures Corporation, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, David O. Selznick and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1932 classic tale by famed author Ernest Hemmingway. Rock Hudson stars as an American ambulance driver during World War I. Wounded in action, he is restored to health by an army nurse played by Jennifer Jones. However, their love affair is doomed as the war hangs like a spectre over their lives. Shot on location in the Dolomite region of Italy, the film is sentimentally tragic and never quite reaches the heights of the earlier version. Vittorio De Sica is excellent as the cynical Major Rinaldi, while Hudson and Jones make an attractive couple, but their performances are hampered by a cliched script.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.brief_description: This is the original Academy Award winning screen version of Hemingway’s well-crafted story of doomed love between Frederic, a wounded ambulance driver (Gary Cooper) and Catherine, his English nurse (Helen Hayes) in Italy in World War I. The war serves merely as a backdrop for their tragic romance. The film is mostly concerned with the fate of Catherine and Frederick - their quick but ardent meeting, their mock wedding in a hospital room, their long and painful separation during which Frederic deserts the army, and Catherine’s death in childbirth. Their farewell scene, where Catherine dies in Frederic’s arms as the bells peal out Armistice, is a moving climax to this all time classic of the screen.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence Weingarten and Sam Wood
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: A Cottage on Dartmoor
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: Released with a synchronised music disc in 1930, but essentially regarded as a silent film. Anthony Asquith last ‘silent’ film was considered a rival to Hitchcock’s ‘Blackmail’. Presents the unrequited love of a barber’s assistant for a manicurist and the results of his jealous rage when she becomes engaged to a customer, relayed in a long flash-back during his attempted escape from Dartmoor. Cast includes: Norah Baring, Uno Henning, Hans Schlettow and Judd Green. Photographed by Stanley Rodwell. Story by Herbert C. Price.

results.title: A Canterbury tale
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Archers Film Productions, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger
results.brief_description: A puzzle when it first appeared, but now hailed as one of Powell and Pressburger’s most suggestive and profound explorations of Englishness, this is a modern-day pilgrimage. Four people, uprooted by the war, are drawn towards Canterbury - and discover what they couldn’t find in peacetime. Described by Derek Jarman as English culture dealt with mythically in a very strange way. Stars Eric Portman, Sheila Sim, and Dennis Price.

results.title: A Bug's life [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios, Darla Anderson, Kevin Reher and John Lasseter
results.brief_description: A Bug’s Life is a perfect example of how technology can be used to tell a good story. The computer generated animation from this Pixar film is amazing, but what makes it watchable are the gorgeous characters and enthralling story. When Flik endangers the future of the ant colony, Princess Atta sends him away to find help. A gang of grasshoppers- led by the menacing Hopper, will return by the end of the summer to accept the colony’s offering, which will take the colony the whole summer to collect. Flik runs into a group of circus performing insects who he mistakenly thinks are warriors. Will the colourful troupe and Flik be able to save the colony from Hopper’s wrath? Includes the voices of Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Phyllis Diller, Denis Leary, Madeline Kahn and Roddy McDowall. The film also includes the Pixar animated short, “The Game”, which won the 1997 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

results.title: A Bronx tale
results.creator_credit: Tribeca Productions, Jane Rosenthal, John Kilik and Robert De Niro
results.brief_description: Calogero Anello is a streetwise nine year old whose father Lorenzo, fights to keep him from being corrupted by the neighbourhood in which they live. The boy witnesses a murder but refuses to identify Sonny, the local crime boss he has long admired, as the perpetrator. Sonny becomes a “surrogate” father to the boy, teaching him to survive in the streets. Over the next eight years, Lorenzo is powerless to stop his son from adopting the dangerous lifestyle of his hero Sonny. Robert De Niro stars and directs this often poignant but tragic motion picture.

results.title: A Bridge too far
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Joseph E. Levine, John Palmer, Joseph E, Richard Levine and Richard Attenborough
results.brief_description: This World War II film is action packed with a renown cast. The film vividly recreates in stunning detail, a controversial episode in military history known as Operation Market Garden. This involved the drop of 35,000 American and British paratroopers into Holland to secure the six major bridges leading to the German border. Sir Richard Attenborough’s direction of this wartime epic is flawless and the film is filled with compelling and unforgettable imagery such as the parachute drop. The vividness and brutality of war, along with the courage and daring of the people involved are emphasised in this production.
